title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praised New England Patriots' culture and head coach Mike Vrabel while encouraging free agents to join.
New England attributes current success to recent free agent signings, including Stefon Diggs and Carlton Davis.
Top potential free agents for the Patriots include receiver George Pickens and edge rusher Jaelan Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks 8th among Patriots' best free-agent signings, excelling in his first season.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million contract, delivering key postseason performances with 5.5 sacks total.
Williams's quick pressures in postseason compare only to Aaron Donald, highlighting his significant impact.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics unlikely to make significant trades before the NBA deadline, focusing on modest roster additions.
Celtics showing interest in Nets center Nic Claxton, but trade may require giving up Anfernee Simons.
Other potential Celtics targets include Mavericks' Daniel Gafford and Kings' guard Keon Ellis.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: 'Something in the Way Fest 2026' features over two dozen indie and alternative rock bands at Boston's Roadrunner.
Baltimore band Angel Du$t's energetic set prompted stage diving and crowd surfing at the Roadrunner venue.
Brooklyn's Momma band announced proceeds from merchandise sales will aid the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins practiced inside a tent structure at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice quality for Sunday's outdoor game.
The NHL constructed a 34-foot high, 125-foot wide, 240-foot long tent to protect the rink from Florida's climate.
Despite protective measures, Bruins players noted the ice remained soft and adapted their game strategy accordingly.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested in Boston Common on Jan. 31, 2026, against ICE and for stronger protections for immigrant communities.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' rally was part of a campaign in over 300 cities, sparked by deaths linked to ICE agents.
Local advocacy groups organized the Boston protest, emphasizing nonviolent resistance and accountability from state officials.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested Trump's immigration policies at Boston Common in 15-degree weather on Saturday.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups as part of a series of national demonstrations.
The protest featured signs, live music by Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band, and took place near the State House steps.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox considered adding an infielder before 2026 season, focusing on defensive help over power.
ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests possible trade targets include Isaac Paredes and unlikely Christian Walker.
Red Sox explored trades with Cubs, but Nico Hoerner is unlikely to be moved, per reports.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, have reached Super Bowl LX after a surprising season.
Patriots achieved a 10-win improvement (14-3) after consecutive 4-13 seasons, guided by coach Mike Vrabel.
Drake Maye, despite playoff struggles, advanced to the Super Bowl, with his family expected to attend.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call Super Bowl LX for NBC, marking his 53rd game involving the Patriots as a broadcaster.
Collinsworth has covered five Super Bowls featuring the Patriots, including a previous matchup against the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
NBC's Collinsworth and Tirico broadcasted three key Patriots games this season, highlighting the team's defensive and offensive strengths.
